2005-03-01 02:00:24 GMT	Canonical.com Patch Queue Manager <pqm@canonical.com>	patch-1347

    Summary:
      Almost finished People Merge. It needs only some UI polish and stuart's magic function to make everything pointing to the dupe account points to the real user account.
    Revision:
      launchpad--devel--0--patch-1347

    Patches applied:
    
     * guilherme.salgado@canonical.com/launchpad--people-merge--0--base-0
       tag of rocketfuel@canonical.com/launchpad--devel--0--patch-1340
    
     * guilherme.salgado@canonical.com/launchpad--people-merge--0--patch-1
       merge from rf
    
     * guilherme.salgado@canonical.com/launchpad--people-merge--0--patch-2
       People Merge, Take One: User can search for the dupe account and request the merge. If the account has more than one registered email address, user can claim all of them.
    
     * guilherme.salgado@canonical.com/launchpad--people-merge--0--patch-3
       People Merge, Take Two: New MergePeopleView, which assigns the dupe account's email to the user and if that's the last email registered for the dupe account we'll have to call stub's blackmagic function to reassign everything that is owned by the dupe account to the user. Also fixed a small bug in ResetPasswordView.
    
     * guilherme.salgado@canonical.com/launchpad--people-merge--0--patch-4
       merge from rf
    
     * guilherme.salgado@canonical.com/launchpad--people-merge--0--patch-5
       Fix queries in database/person.py to always return a list of objects, so we don't have to use lots of count()s. Lots of new pagetests: account creation, login, email add, people merge, email deletion, set of preferred email and reset password.

     * carlos.perello@canonical.com--2004/launchpad--devel--0--patch-469
       Catch an exception when the Last-Translator field does not exists in the imported pofile
    
     * carlos.perello@canonical.com--2004/launchpad--devel--0--patch-470
       Fixed a problem that prevents to sync sqlobjects because the list changes while we iterate over it
    
     * carlos.perello@canonical.com--2004/launchpad--devel--0--patch-471
       If we get any error, we abort the transaction so we force a new transaction

2005-01-05 17:00:57 GMT	Canonical.com Patch Queue Manager <pqm@canonical.com>	patch-1151

    Summary:
      Added 'login' attribute to the LaunchBag that gives the user id / email address that was used to log in, whether by cookie auth or by basic auth.
    Revision:
      launchpad--devel--0--patch-1151

    Patches applied:
    
     * steve.alexander@canonical.com/launchpad--devel--0--patch-286
       refuel
    
     * steve.alexander@canonical.com/launchpad--devel--0--patch-287
       added logged-in events for basic auth and cookie auth.  added interface to a utility that will be used by code to get information about the logged-in person and the metadata about how they logged in.
    
     * steve.alexander@canonical.com/launchpad--devel--0--patch-288
       removed xxxLoginInfo interfaces, as they are not the right way to do what i need to do.  added PrincipalIdentified events in addition to LoggedInEvents.  (thanks daniel silverstone for helping me find good words for concepts.)  added login to the launchbox.  all that is needed now is an event handler to set the login attribute of the launchbox whenever a principal is identified.
    
     * steve.alexander@canonical.com/launchpad--devel--0--patch-289
       removed the complex forms of LoggedInEvent interfaces, keeping just the simple one.  added a subscriber to PrincipalIdentifiedEvent that sets the login attribute of the launchbag.  in the future, we might use this to set the user too, instead of getting the user from the interaction.  that would need some thought, though.
    
     * steve.alexander@canonical.com/launchpad--devel--0--patch-290
       made system doctest ftest use all .txt files in launchpad/doc/.
    
     * steve.alexander@canonical.com/launchpad--devel--0--patch-291
       made launchbag.txt thoroughly test the login attribute of the launchbag.  fixed bugs revealed during writing the test.  made the login attribute cleared on a logout.
    
     * steve.alexander@canonical.com/launchpad--devel--0--patch-292
       improved xxx comment in launchbag test.
    
     * steve.alexander@canonical.com/launchpad--devel--0--patch-293
       refuel

2004-11-22 19:53:31 GMT	Canonical.com Patch Queue Manager <pqm@canonical.com>	patch-832

    Summary:
      Massive *Container to *Set renaming. All the interfaces and classes used by soyuz, rosetta and malone named <something>Container was renamed to <something>Set. The IProjectContainer and ProjectContainer classes were deleted since the respecting Set was already implemented and all the other class using the Container was changed to use the Set one. I hope it does not break anything. At least launchpad is running and all tests passed sucessifuly.
    Revision:
      launchpad--devel--0--patch-832
